item.title: 泰国称柬埔寨边境之战也是一场打击骗子的战争
item.description: 泰国军队将其与柬埔寨的致命冲突改编成了一场打击网络犯罪分子的战斗，为越境轰炸行动增添了新的动机，称其目的是根除诈骗分子。【原文：Thailand’s army has recast its deadly clash with Cambodia as a battle against cybercriminals, adding a new motive for bombing runs across the border that it says are aimed at rooting out scammers.】

item.description: 丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.日本汽车制造商协会（Japan Automobile Manufacturers' Association）首席执行官佐藤浩二（Koji Sato）将掌舵该协会，并在该行业面临关税和芯片短缺等高度不确定性的关键时刻领导该协会。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. item.title: 五只欧洲生物技术股将于 2026 年迎来关键性试验结果
item.description: 今年是欧洲生物技术股的大年：Abivax SA 公司的一种肠道疾病药物试验取得成功后，股价飙升了约 1300%；Argenx SE 公司被纳入欧洲斯托克 50 指数的精英公司行列；Valneva SE 公司和 Inventiva 公司等规模较小的公司也取得了令人瞩目的涨幅。【原文：It’s been a big year for European biotech stocks: Abivax SA soared about 1,300% after successful trial results for a bowel disease drug, Argenx SE was added to the elite Euro Stoxx 50 Index and smaller names including Valneva SE and Inventiva also had impressive rallies.】

item.title: 瑞典将利率维持在 1.75%，增长加快，通胀降温
item.description: 瑞典中央银行将借贷成本维持在三年来的最低水平，并重申了在 2027 年之前保持不变的计划，因为经济复苏正在加强，价格压力似乎正在缓解。【原文：Sweden’s central bank kept borrowing costs at a three-year low and repeated a plan for no change until 2027 as economic recovery strengthens and price pressure appears to be easing.】

item.title: 美国关税缓和前 11 月瑞士钟表出口下降
item.description: 瑞士钟表出口连续第四个月下降，原因是企业在等待美国放宽惩罚性进口关税的协议生效。【原文：Swiss watch exports fell for a fourth month as companies waited for the US agreement to ease punitive import tariffs to take effect.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将在乌克兰战争结束后长期为其付出代价
item.description: 即使明天战斗就结束了，俄罗斯也将在未来数年内为入侵乌克兰付出代价，因为政府将用越来越昂贵的借贷来填补不断扩大的军事预算缺口。【原文：Russia will be paying for its invasion of Ukraine for years to come even if the fighting ended tomorrow, as the government plugs a widening gap in the military budget with increasingly costly borrowing.】

item.title: 股票多头需要思考的 2026 年风险清单长得令人担忧
item.description: 美股正以积极的势头和一系列看涨预测迈向 2026 年。要实现许多人预测的第四年强劲涨势，美股还必须克服许多潜在威胁。【原文：US stocks are heading into 2026 with positive momentum and a host of bullish forecasts at their backs. For the fourth year of strong gains that many predict to play out, they must still overcome plenty of potential threats.】

item.title: 中国已从美国购买了超过一半的大豆
item.description: 据熟悉交易的人士称，在过去两周的大量采购后，中国已获得至少 700 万吨美国大豆，距离实现与特朗普政府达成的 1200 万吨采购协议已过半。【原文：China has secured at least 7 million tons of US soybeans after heavy buying in the past two weeks, passing the halfway mark toward meeting its 12-million ton purchase agreement with the Trump administration, according to people familiar with the deals.】

item.title: 英国石油公司新老板如何成为化石燃料领域最有权力的女性
item.description: 梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）是全球最大的化石燃料公司之一，她的快速崛起没有受到任何质疑。当石油公司的高管们还在被逼着放弃碳氢化合物时，她却提出了不同的论点：世界与碳氢化合物的关系还远远没有结束。【原文：Meg O’Neill’s rapid rise to the top of one of the world’s biggest fossil-fuel companies has been unencumbered by doubt. At a moment when oil executives are still being pressed to move away from hydrocarbons, she has a different argument: that the world is nowhere near done with them.】

item.title: Anthropic、OpenAI 寻求更多办公空间以拓展欧洲市场
item.description: OpenAI和Anthropic正寻求扩大在都柏林的办事处规模，此举凸显了两家公司在欧洲日益增长的影响力，以及促进其人工智能服务在全球范围内普及的竞争态势。【原文：OpenAI and Anthropic are looking to expand their office footprints in Dublin, a move that underscores both firms’ growing presence in Europe and the race to boost global uptake of their artificial intelligence services.】

item.title: 印度主要出口邦称美国关税正在摧毁印度产业
item.description: 印度最富裕、严重依赖出口的邦之一表示，美国的高关税正在给该地区的企业造成 "不可挽回的损失"，并呼吁印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪紧急寻求与华盛顿达成贸易协议。【原文：One of India’s richest states that’s heavily reliant on exports said high US tariffs are causing “irreparable damage” to businesses in the region and called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi to urgently seek a trade deal with Washington.】

item.title: 安哥拉为洛比托铁路获得7.53亿美元美国和南非贷款
item.description: 安哥拉获得7.53亿美元融资，以加快洛比托铁路走廊的开发，结束了因政府担保谈判而造成的数月拖延。【原文：Angola secured $753 million in financing to speed up development of the Lobito rail corridor, ending months of delays tied to talks over government guarantees.】

玻利维亚宣布经济紧急状态，取消燃料补贴
item.description: 玻利维亚总统罗德里戈-帕斯（Rodrigo Paz）于周三深夜宣布进入经济紧急状态，并颁布了一系列引人注目的措施，包括取消燃料补贴和放松国家汇率制度。【原文：Bolivian President Rodrigo Paz declared an economic emergency late Wednesday night and issued an array of dramatic steps, including scrapping fuel subsidies and loosening the country’s exchange rate regime.】

item.description: 意大利初创公司 Exein SpA 新近融资 1 亿欧元（1.18 亿美元），目标是防止黑客入侵汽车、家用路由器和婴儿监视器等联网设备。【原文：Italian startup Exein SpA has raised €100 million ($118 million) in fresh funding with the goal of keeping hackers out of connected devices including cars, home routers and baby monitors.】

item.title: 成本上涨促使不活跃的英国人重返劳动力市场
item.description: 在英国失业率再次上升后，政府大臣斯蒂芬-金诺克（Stephen Kinnock）指出，劳动力市场的核心问题是另一个危机--经济不活跃。"他本周表示："有工作能力的人应该工作。【原文：After UK unemployment rose again, government minister Stephen Kinnock pointed to a different crisis — economic inactivity — as the real problem at the heart of the labor market. “People who can work should be working,” he said this week, echoing concerns in both Westminster and at the Bank of England.】

item.title: 南非顶级基金经理认为 2026 年非资源类股票将反弹
item.description: 南非顶级投资公司 Ninety One Plc 的一位资深基金经理表示，鉴于南非非商品类公司股票在 2025 年的表现落后于当地债券和更广泛的股票指数，这些公司股票将在明年出现反弹。【原文：Stocks of non-commodity South African companies look set to rally next year given they trade at a deep discount and trailed the performance of both local bonds and the wider equity gauge in 2025, according to a veteran fund manager at Ninety One Plc the nation’s top investment firm.】
